Detailed Description

The ISubject interface supplies loosely coupling systems with dependency It facilitates a lazy behaviour where by systems only need to react to a change and facilitates dependent callback threading.

Related interfaces:
IObserver
IChangeManager

This interface follows the pattern commonly know as the Observer pattern, the Publish/Subscribe pattern, or the Dependents pattern.

The Observer pattern is documented in "Design Patterns," written by Erich Gamma et. al., published by Addison-Wesley in 1995.

Member Function Documentation

virtual Error ISubject::Attach ( IObserver *  pInObserver,
u32  uInIntrestBits,
u32  uID,
u32  shiftBits = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Associates the provided IObserver with the given ISubject aspects of interest.

This method is typically called from ChangeManager::Register() or the IObserver, if used without a ChangeManager.

Parameters:
pInObserver A pointer to the IObserver.
uInIntrestBits The aspects of interest that changed as defined by the supplied ISubject's published interest bits.
uID ID assigned by pInObserver to this subject.
shiftBits Used for components supporting multiply inherited interfaces each with subject interfaces.
Returns:
One of the following Error codes: Error::Success No error. Error::InvalidAddress pInObserver and/or pInSubject was NULL. Error::OutOfMemory Not enough memory is available to resolve the change. /returns>

virtual Error ISubject::Detach ( IObserver *  pInObserver  )  [pure virtual]

Disassociates the provided Observer with the Subject.

This method is typically called from ChangeManager::Register() or the IObserver, if used without a ChangeManager.

Parameters:
pInObserver A pointer to the IObserver that should be disassociated.
Returns:
One of the following Error codes: Error::Success No error. Error::InvalidAddress pInObserver and/or pInSubject was NULL. /returns>

virtual u32 ISubject::GetID ( IObserver *  pObserver  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns the ID assigned by pObserver to this subject.

virtual void ISubject::PostChanges ( System::Changes::BitMask  uInChangedBits  )  [pure virtual]

Publishes to attached Observers and ChanageManager that changes have occurred.

This method is typically called from ChangeManager::Register() or the IObserver, if used without a ChangeManager.

Parameters:
uInChangedBits TThe u32 bit field that describes the conceptual change with respect to the published interests.
Returns:
One of the following Error codes: Error::Success No error. Error::InvalidAddress pInObserver and/or pInSubject was NULL. /returns>

virtual System::Changes::BitMask ISubject::GetPotentialSystemChanges ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Identifies the system changes that this subject could possibly make.

Returns:
A bitmask of the possible system changes.

virtual void ISubject::PreDestruct ( void   )  [pure virtual]

Forces the Destruction.

Returns:
One of the following Error codes: Error::Success No error. Error::InvalidAddress pInObserver and/or pInSubject was NULL. /returns>
